Trover.definition: an action at common law to recover the value of chattels or goods wrongfully converted by another to his or her own use compare detinue
Trover.origin: [short for action of trover and conversion; Anglo-French trover act of finding (alluding to goods lost by the plaintiff and found by the defendant), from trover to find, from Old French]

1.1: an action at common law to recover the value of chattels or goods wrongfully converted by another to his or her own use compare
